snippet: At one point, the ships came within 12 nautical miles of the United States, which put them inside American territorial waters, a spokesman said.
abstract: Defense officials report five Chinese Navy ships entered United States territorial waters in Bering Sea off Alaskan coast, but were in legal transit and complied with international law; says sighting, which occurred while Pres Obama was touring Alaska, was first time military noted such activity by China.
lead_paragraph: At one point, the ships came within 12 nautical miles of the United States, which put them inside American territorial waters, a spokesman said.

headline.main: Chinese Navy Ships Entered U.S. Waters Legally, Pentagon Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Pentagon Says Naval Ships Entered U.S. Waters Off Alaska
